params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface
params.validator: Must be one of: interface, bmc, bond, bridge.

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: identifier
params.description: L’identificador de dispositiu, p. ex. eth0 o eth1.1

params.name: managed
params.description: Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: provider
params.description: Interface provider, e.g. IPMI. Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, this attribute has precedence over the subnet VLAN ID. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs, e.g. eth1. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mode
params.description: Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.
params.validator: Must be one of: balance-rr, active-backup, balance-xor, broadcast, 802.3ad, balance-tlb, balance-alb.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

domains.name: Domains
domains.full_description: Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are or the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

params.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).

for example http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.

methods.name: bulk_search
methods.full_description: For every search it returns the list of tasks that satisfty the condition. The reason for supporting multiple searches is the UI that might be ending needing periodic updates on task status for various searches at the same time. This way, it is possible to get all the task statuses with one request.

params.name: searches
params.description: List of uuids to fetch info about
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: search_id
params.description: Arbitraty value for client to identify the the request parts with results. It’s passed in the results to be able to pair the requests and responses properly.

params.name: type
params.validator: Must be one of: user, resource, task.

params.name: task_id
params.description: In case :type = ‘task’, find the task by the uuid

params.name: user_id
params.description: In case :type = ‘user’, find tasks for the user

params.name: resource_type
params.description: In case :type = ‘resource’, what resource type we’re searching the tasks for

params.name: resource_type
params.description: In case :type = ‘resource’, what resource id we’re searching the tasks for

params.name: action_types
params.description: Return just tasks of given action type, e.g. [Actions::Katello::Repository::Synchronize]

params.name: task_ids
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: per_page
params.description: Number of results per page to return

params.name: order
params.description: How to order the sorted results (e.g. ASC for ascending)
